intro: Disporopsis fuscopicta var. arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan disporopsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly waxy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
